intro: Lobelia oxyphylla var. cacuminis, commonly known as the pink lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and ecological benefits.
